alert.note: Alert for GUC100; GUC110; GUC120; Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 08 at 8:30PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A developing monsoon trough and moderate surge combined with a possible tropical disturbance is expected to bring heavy rain to the Marianas from Tuesday to Friday next week. A monsoon trough is currently in place across the Marianas, with easterly winds over Tinian and Saipan and south to west winds for Guam and Rota. The monsoon trough looks to remain fairly stationary over the next several days, then drift northward as weak circulations develop and move west-northwestward, dragging the trough with them. Early to midweek next week, a modest surge is expected over the region, resulting in increasing convection. This surge and associated increased moisture looks to maintain moderate to heavy showers across the Marianas through the remainder of the week. Latest model guidance varies on expected rainfall amounts, with the ECMWF being the most consistent. Amounts range from 6 to 12 inches for the ECMWF to 3 to 4 inches for the GFS. Regardless, the developing situation looks very favorable for locally heavy rainfall capable of producing flash flooding across the Marianas. Residents need to closely monitor this developing situation as watches, advisories and warnings could be issued as early as Tuesday. If living near streams and rivers, prepare to move items away from stream and river banks. Make sure storm drains nearby are not clogged, especially if living in low-lying areas. This outlook will be updated over the next few days with additional information, or cancelled if the situation changes.
